SENT.plain: The Sturge-Weber syndrome consists of a unilateral port-wine hemangioma of the skin along the trigeminal distribution and is accompanied by an ipsilateral leptomeningeal angioma
Glaucoma is present in approximately half of the cases
The Nevus of Ota is a melanocytic pigmentary disorder, most commonly involving the area innervated by the trigeminal nerve
Elevated intraocular pressure, with or without glaucomatous damage, is observed in 10% of the cases
We report the first case of glaucoma associated with Sturge-Weber syndrome and Nevus of Ota in Korea
